SourceProxy.name: SlamOnline
SourceProxy.label: SLAM (online)

Documentation.short_help: Performs real-time SLAM on the Lidar sensor's pointclouds.
Documentation.long_help: Performs real-time SLAM on the Lidar sensor's pointclouds.

SourceProxy.Documentation:
The SLAM filter uses LiDAR sensor pointclouds to compute sensor's trajectory and build a map of the environment.
The SLAM algorithm is composed of four sequential steps:
- Sampling strategy: extract keypoints that provide strong geometric information
- Ego-Motion: estimate sensor motion since last frame
- Localization: compute current frame pose in map using estimated Ego-Motion
- Map update : add current registered points in map
This filter performs real-time processing of input frames (it may skip some frames if too slow) with live display.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.label: Point Cloud
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input port to use where LiDAR point clouds are broadcasted.

InputProperty.name: Calibration
InputProperty.Documentation: Optional LiDAR sensor calibration to use to correct laser rings' IDs.

Property.name: Reset state
Property.Documentation: Reset SLAM internal state : maps and trajectory are cleared, and current pose is set back to origin. This keeps parameters and sensor data unchanged.

StringVectorProperty.name: SensorDataFile
StringVectorProperty.Documentation:
The path of the external sensor data file to use.
This CSV file can have the following columns:
*time*: Posix time, in seconds
*odom*: Wheel odometry, in meters
*acc_x/acc_y/acc_z*: Acceleration from IMU, in meters/second

IntVectorProperty.name: Auto detect input arrays
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If enabled, SLAM filter will try to auto-detect the time, intensity and laser ring id arrays to use depending on LiDAR model.

StringVectorProperty.name: Laser ring id array
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The laser ring ids that acquired points.

StringVectorProperty.name: Elevation angles calibration
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Calibration column used to sort laser rings by ascending elevation angle (the lowest/bottom laser ring should be 0, and it should increase upward).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Time to seconds factor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Coefficient to apply to *Time array* values to express timestamps in seconds.

IntVectorProperty.name: Advanced return mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
If advanced return mode is enabled, extra arrays are added to the outputs to display some of the SLAM internal variables :
- Trajectory : matching summary, localization error summary, confidence estimators
- Output transformed frame : saliency, planarity, intensity gap, keypoint validity
- Extracted keypoints : ICP matching results
It is very useful when debugging or checking the SLAM behavior. If disabled, the overlap estimation is not computed.

IntVectorProperty.name: Output keypoints maps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If enabled, SLAM filter will output keypoints maps. Otherwise, these filter outputs are left empty to save time.

IntVectorProperty.name: Keypoints maps update step
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: SLAM filter will update keypoints maps only 1 frame over *step* to save time.

IntVectorProperty.name: Output current keypoints
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If enabled, SLAM filter will output keypoints extracted from current frame. Otherwise, these filter outputs are left empty to save time.

IntVectorProperty.name: Output keypoints in WORLD coordinates
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
If disabled, return raw keypoints extracted from current frame in BASE coordinates, without undistortion.
If enabled, return keypoints in WORLD coordinates, optionally undistorted if undistortion is activated.

IntVectorProperty.name: 2d mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Optimize only 2D pose in BASE coordinates. Only X, Y (ground coordinates) and yaw (rZ) will be optimized, whereas Z (elevation), rX (roll) and rY (pitch) will be held constant.

IntVectorProperty.name: Use blobs
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If enabled, blob keypoints are used in localization step.

IntVectorProperty.name: Verbosity level

Entry.text: 0) Errors, warnings or one time info

IntVectorProperty.name: Ego-Motion mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
How to estimate Ego-Motion (approximate relative motion since last frame). The ego-motion step aims to give a fast and approximate initialization of new frame world pose to ensure faster and more precise convergence in Localization step.
If DISABLED, no ego-motion step is performed : relative motion is Identity, new estimated Tworld is equal to previous Tworld. Fast, but may lead to unstable and imprecise Localization step if motion is important.
If MOTION EXTRAPOLATION, previous motion is linearly extrapolated to estimate new Tworld pose from the 2 previous poses. Fast and precise if motion is roughly constant and continuous.
If REGISTRATION ON PREVIOUS FRAME, Trelative (and therefore Tworld) is estimated by globally registering new frame on previous frame. Slower and need textured enough environment, but do not rely on constant motion hypothesis.
If MOTION EXTRAPOLATION + REGISTRATION ON PREVIOUS FRAME, previous motion is linearly extrapolated to estimate new Tworld pose from the 2 previous poses. Then this estimation is refined by globally registering new frame on previous frame. Slower and need textured enough environment, but should be more precise and rely less on constant motion hypothesis.

IntVectorProperty.name: Undistortion mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Undistortion mode, to correct rolling shutter distortion during frame acquisition. The undistortion should greatly improve the accuracy for smooth motions, but might be unstable for high-frequency motions.
DISABLED: no undistortion is performed.
ONCE: undistortion is performed only once using estimated ego-motion.
REFINED: undistortion is iteratively refined using optimized ego-motion.

IntVectorProperty.name: Number of threads
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Max number of threads to use for parallel processing.

StringVectorProperty.name: Initial map files prefix
StringVectorProperty.Documentation:
The path prefix of the initial map files.
3 maps will be searched and loaded if found: path/to/maps/prefix*edges.pcd* path/to/maps/prefix*planes.pcd* path/to/maps/prefix*blobs.pcd*

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Initial pose XYZ
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Translation elements of the initial SLAM pose in format X, Y, Z

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Initial pose RPY
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Rotation elements of the initial SLAM pose in format Roll, Pitch, Yaw

ProxyProperty.name: KeyPointsExtractor
ProxyProperty.label: Keypoints extractor
ProxyProperty.Documentation: The keypoints extractor to use to get keypoints from raw input frame.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Translation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
Position of the LiDAR sensor in BASE coordinate system (X, Y, Z).
It is often useful to track a BASE pose instead of LiDAR sensor pose. If set, this parameter transform all input pointcloud into BASE coordinate system in order to output BASE trajectory.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Rotation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
Rotation of the LiDAR sensor in BASE coordinate system (rX, rY, rZ, euler angles in ZYX convention, in degrees).
It is often useful to track a BASE pose instead of LiDAR sensor pose. If set, this parameter transform all input pointcloud into BASE coordinate system in order to output BASE trajectory.

IntVectorProperty.name: ICP-Optimization iterations EM
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
The registration of the current frame on the previous frame is performed iteratively, building point-to-model Mahalanobis distance functions during an ICP step, followed by a non-linear optimization of these residuals.
This parameter is the number of ICP-optimization iterations to perform.

IntVectorProperty.name: LM optimization iterations EM
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Max number of iterations of the Levenberg-Marquardt optimizer to solve the ICP problem

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Max neighbors distance EM
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Max distance allowed between a keypoint and its neighbors from the previous frame to build an ICP match

IntVectorProperty.name: Edge nb of neighbors EM
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Initial number of edge neighbors to extract, that will be filtered out to keep best candidates.
At least 2 points are needed to build a valid line model. If below, line models won't be usable and will be ignored.

IntVectorProperty.name: Edge nb min filtered neighbors EM
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Min number of resulting filtered edge neighbors (max 1 per scan line) to approximate the corresponding line model.
At least 2 points are needed to build a valid line model. If below, line models won't be usable and will be ignored.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Edge PCA factor EM
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
To check the line neighborhood shape, the PCA eigenvalues must respect:
*EigenValue2 >= Factor x EigenValue1*
with *EigenValue2 >= EigenValue1 >= EigenValue0*

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Edge max model error EM
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Max RMSE allowed between neighborhood and its fitted line model to keep only accurate models

IntVectorProperty.name: Plane nb of neighbors EM
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Number of plane neighbors to extract to approximate the corresponding plane model.
At least 3 points are needed to build a valid plane model. If below, plane models won't be usable and will be ignored.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Plane PCA factor 1 EM
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
To check the plane neighborhood shape, the PCA eigenvalues must respect:
*EigenValue1 >= Factor1 x EigenValue0*
*Factor2 x EigenValue1 >= EigenValue2*
with *EigenValue2 >= EigenValue1 >= EigenValue0*

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Plane PCA factor 2 EM
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
To check the plane neighborhood shape, the PCA eigenvalues must respect:
*EigenValue1 >= Factor1 x EigenValue0*
*Factor2 x EigenValue1 >= EigenValue2*
with *EigenValue2 >= EigenValue1 >= EigenValue0*

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Plane max model error EM
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Max RMSE allowed between neighborhood and its fitted plane model to keep only accurate models

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Init saturation distance EM
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
Maximum distance (in meters) beyond which the residual errors are saturated to robustify the optimization against outlier constraints. The residuals will be robustified by Tukey loss (50% of saturation at *SaturationDistance/2*, fully saturated at *SaturationDistance*).
The saturation distance at each iteration is linearly interpolated between *Init* and *Final* saturation distance parameters.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Final saturation distance EM
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
Maximum distance (in meters) beyond which the residual errors are saturated to robustify the optimization against outlier constraints. The residuals will be robustified by Tukey loss (50% of saturation at *SaturationDistance/2*, fully saturated at *SaturationDistance*).
The saturation distance at each iteration is linearly interpolated between *Init* and *Final* saturation distance parameters.

PropertyGroup.label: Localization ICP matching and optimization parameters

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Keyframe distance threshold
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimum distance to travel since last keyframe to add a new one. Only keyframes' points are added to the map.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Keyframe angle threshold
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimum angle (in degrees) to rotate since last keyframe to add a new one. Only keyframes' points are added to the map.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Edges map resolution
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimum size of a leaf when downsampling the edges map using a voxel grid filter. It should not be too big or some high frequency geometric information will be lost. It should not be too low or the geometric information will be too local and computation time may increase.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Planes map resolution
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimum size of a leaf when downsampling the planes map using a voxel grid filter. It should not be too big or some high frequency geometric information will be lost. It should not be too low or the geometric information will be too local and computation time may increase.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Blobs map resolution
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimum size of a leaf when downsampling the blobs map using a voxel grid filter. It should not be too big or some high frequency geometric information will be lost. It should not be too low or the geometric information will be too local and computation time may increase.

IntVectorProperty.name: Rolling grid dimension
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Number of voxels in each direction of the rolling grid. It should be large enough to store a local map around current pose, but a too high value largely increase memory consumption.
Each map is a *Rolling Grid*, storing points in a local outer cube of size *number of voxels x voxel resolution* meters. When a point should be added in the map but lies outside this outer cube, the whole map is rolled towards this point in order to save it, forgetting previous voxels in the opposite direction.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Rolling grid resolution
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Resolution of a voxel of the rolling grid (meters per voxel). It should not be too big or too much points will be considered when trying to match the frame at the current position. This does not impact accuracy but only speed.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Overlap sampling ratio
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
Ratio of points (between 0 and 1) from the current frame to compute overlap on.
The overlap estimates how much the current scan is well registered on the current maps.
Downsampling accelerates the overlap computation, but may be less precise. A ratio of 1 uses all points, 0.5 uses 1 point over 2, etc., 0 disables overlap computation.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Velocity limits
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
Velocity thresholds to evaluate and discard pose.
translation speed: m/s
rotation speed: °/s

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Acceleration limits
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation:
Acceleration threshold to evaluate and discard pose.
translation acceleration: m/s^2
rotation acceleration: °/s^2

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Time window duration
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Duration of the window on poses to estimate the velocity in seconds.

Documentation.short_help: Performs offline processing SLAM on the Lidar sensor's pointclouds.
Documentation.long_help: Performs offline processing SLAM on the Lidar sensor's pointclouds.

SourceProxy.Documentation:
The SLAM filter uses LiDAR sensor pointclouds to compute sensor's trajectory and build a map of the environment.
The SLAM algorithm is composed of four sequential steps:
- Sampling strategy: extract keypoints that provide strong geometric information
- Ego-Motion: estimate sensor motion since last frame
- Localization: compute current frame pose in map using estimated Ego-Motion
- Map update : add current registered points in map
This filter performs offline processing of all input frames without live display.

IntVectorProperty.name: All frames
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Process all frames of the recording.

IntVectorProperty.name: First frame
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The first frame to process.

IntVectorProperty.name: Last frame
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The last frame to process.

IntVectorProperty.name: Step size
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Process one frame every StepSize frames (e.g. every (1) frame, every 2 frames, every 3 frames, and so on). A step size of 1 means that all frames between the first and the last (included) will be used. This property can be useful to trade robustness (step size equal to 1) and accuracy for speed (step size greater than 1).

Proxy.name: SpinningSensorKeypointExtractor
Proxy.label: Spinning Sensor Keypoint Extractor

Documentation.short_help: Extract keypoints from a spinning LiDAR sensor pointcloud.
Documentation.long_help: Extract edges, planes and blobs keypoints from a spinning LiDAR sensor pointcloud.

Proxy.Documentation: Extract edges, planes and blobs keypoints from a spinning LiDAR sensor pointcloud.

IntVectorProperty.name: Neighborhood width
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Number of neighbors to use on each side of current point to estimate the keypoints scores (curvature, planarity, depth gap, ...) in each scan line.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Min distance to sensor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimum distance between a point and the sensor to be processed for the keypoint extraction. In other words, all points too close from the sensor are automatically rejected.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Min laser beam to surface angle
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimum angle between the laser beam and the surface on which a point is laying to consider it as a potential keypoint. In other words, all points laying on too oblique surfaces relatively to the sensor are automatically rejected.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Plane max sinus angle
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: One strategy to consider a point as a planar keypoint is to compute the angle between the two lines that fit its previous and next neighborhoods. If the angle is close enough to 0° or 180° (sin(Angle) low enough), we consider the point as a planar keypoint.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Edge min sinus angle
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: One strategy to consider a point as an edge keypoint is to compute the angle between the two lines that fit its previous and next neighborhoods. If the angle is close enough to 90° (sin(Angle) high enough), we consider the point as an edge keypoint.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Edge min saliency distance
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: One strategy to consider a point as an edge keypoint is to compute the depth gap between the point and its far background neighborhood. If the gap is big enough, we consider the point as an edge keypoint.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Edge min intensity gap
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: One strategy to consider a point as an edge keypoint is to compute the intensity gap between the point and its left and right neighbors. If the gap is big enough, we consider the point as an edge keypoint.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Edge min depth gap
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: One strategy to consider a point as an edge keypoint is to compute the gap between the point and its neighborhood, fitted by a line. Then we compute the distance between the point and the fitted lines. If the gap is big enough on at least one side, we consider the point as an edge keypoint.
